jNetDev.Headers
Class jND_UDP

java.lang.Object
  jNetDev.Headers.jND_UDP

public class jND_UDP
extends java.lang.Object

jND_UDP
Class to model a UDP header. A UDP header has the following fields:

  • sourcePort - the port # of the sender.
  • destPort - the port # of the intended receiver.
  • dataLength - the length of the payload.
  • checkSum
The payload of the packet is NOT, strictly speaking, part of the header, but is a sequence of bytes following the header. 
 Header format:
    +--------------------------------+--------------------------------+
    |             sourcePort         |            destPort            |
    +----------------16--------------+---------------16---------------+
    |            dataLength          |            checkSum            |
    +----------------16--------------+---------------16---------------+

dataLength

public void dataLength(jND_BYTE2 len)
Method to set the data length of the packet. There is no actual reason to set this, as it is calculated when the packet is built and the calculated value overrides whatever is set via this method.

Parameters:
len - - the data length

sourceIP

public jND_IPv4Address sourceIP()
Method to retrieve the source IP address. The parse() method does NOT set this, as it is not actually in the UDP header. To retrieve this value, you should use the appropriate accessor of the IPv4 header class.

Returns:
the source IP address

sourceIP

public void sourceIP(jND_IPv4Address srcIP)
Method to set the source IP address. This is not actually included in the UDP header. However, it must be provided so that the build() method can calculate the checksum. The checksum for transport layer headers includes a pseudo header with the source and destination IP addresses in it.

Parameters:
srcIP - - the source IP address

destinationIP

public jND_IPv4Address destinationIP()
Method to retrieve the destination IP address. The parse() method does NOT set this, as it is not actually in the UDP header. To retrieve this value, you should use the appropriate accessor of the IPv4 header class.

Returns:
the destination IP address

destinationIP

public void destinationIP(jND_IPv4Address destIP)
Method to set the destination IP address. This is not actually included in the UDP header. However, it must be provided so that the build() method can calculate the checksum. The checksum for transport layer headers includes a pseudo header with the source and destination IP addresses in it.

Parameters:
destIP - - the destination IP address

parse

public void parse(byte[] pkt)
Method to parse a raw packet into its parts. This is a convenience method equivalent to parse(pkt, 0);

Parameters:
pkt - - the packet to parse.

parse

                  int offset)
Method to parse a raw packet into its parts.

Parameters:
pkt - - the packet to parse.
offset - - where in the packet to start parsing.

build

public byte[] build()
Method to build a packet for sending, from its parts.

a byte array which is the packet.
